alert.note: Alert for Winston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 2:45PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Winston County through 315 PM CDT... At 245 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Winston Free State Barn, or 7 miles northeast of Lynn, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lynn, Double Springs, Houston Recreational Area, Camp McDowell, Ashbank, Corinth Rec Area, Poplar Springs, Winston Free State Barn, Smith Lake, Weiss, Clear Creek, Winston County Airport, Cane Creek, Seymour Branch, Mill Creek, Rockhouse Creek, Curtis Crossroads, Black Pond and Coon Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
